recordTypes.name: Dog License
recordTypes.description: For more information, please see Newburyport Code of Ordinances Ch. 3, Article II, Sec. 3-27.

recordTypes.name: License to Occupy Outdoor City Property/Outdoor Dining
recordTypes.description: For more information, please see Newburyport Code of Ordinances Ch. 12, Article I, Sec. 12-1.8 - Sec. 12-1.9.

recordTypes.name: Annual Flammable Certificate of Registration
recordTypes.description: All materials must be stored in accordance with the provisions of Massachusetts General Law, Chapter 148, the Massachusetts Fire Code (527 CMR), and all other applicable laws and regulations, including the terms and conditions of the subject license. Quantities stored may not exceed the maximum quantity specified by the license.

recordTypes.name: Parks Reservations
recordTypes.description: Registration and Reservation Hub

recordTypes.name: Capital Project Request
recordTypes.description: This form is used for City departments to submit capital projects for potential inclusion in the five-year capital improvement plan.

recordTypes.name: How to Add or Update Documents to an Existing Permit
HOME PORT
recordTypes.description: HOME PORT is offered through the Affordable Housing Trust and offers up to $20,000 for eligible buyers to be put towards purchasing a property in Newburyport.

recordTypes.name: How to Search for a Location or Record
Accessory Structure Letter Permit
recordTypes.description: One-story accessory structures used as sheds, playhouses, and similar uses 200 square feet or less must be reviewed by the Zoning Administrator for compliance with the Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Approval Not Required
recordTypes.description: Applicants who wish to record a plan of land in the Registry of Deeds or the Land Court and who believe that the plan does not require approval under the Subdivision Control Law may apply here for a determination that the subject plan does not require subdivision approval.

recordTypes.name: WPA Form 1 - Request for Determination of Applicability
recordTypes.description: The Request for Determination of Applicability (RDA) provides applicants with the option of seeking a determination as to whether the Wetlands Protection Act applies to a proposed site or activity.

recordTypes.name: Appeal
recordTypes.description: Any person as defined by MGL Chapter 40A Section 8 that is aggrieved due to his inability to obtain a permit from the Inspector of Buildings under the provisions of this ordinance or by order or decision of the Zoning Administrator shall use this application to file an appeal to the Zoning Board of Appeals. Appeals must be submitted within thirty (30) days from the date of the order or decision that is being appealed.

recordTypes.name: ABCC Retail  License
recordTypes.description: All alcohol Beverages

recordTypes.name: Accessory Dwelling Unit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for to apply for a building permit for an attached, detached, or internal Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU).

recordTypes.name: Annual Food Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new, existing (renewal), and seasonal food establishments. Please note -- temporary food events has a separate permit application.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure Letter Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use the Accessory Structure Letter Permit application here: https://newburyportma.portal.opengov.com/categories/1096/record-types/1006546

recordTypes.name: Alcohol Beverage NEW  License
recordTypes.description: All alcohol Beverages

recordTypes.name: Comprehensive Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request a Comprehensive Permit from the Zoning Board of Appeals.

recordTypes.name: Yard Sale Permit
recordTypes.description: For more information, please see Newburyport Code of Ordinances Ch. 9, Article I, Sec. 9-2.

recordTypes.name: Definitive Subdivision
recordTypes.description: This application is used to submit a Definitive Subdivision Plan or modification to a previously approved plan to the Planning Board for its approval.

recordTypes.name: WPA Form 3 - Notice of Intent
recordTypes.description: Notice of Intent (NOI) applications are required to obtain an Order of Conditions for removal, dredging, filling, or in any way altering of wetland resource areas or their 100-foot buffer zones.

recordTypes.name: Water Sheet Application
recordTypes.description: This application is used to review the placement of moorings, floats, piers, and other docking mechanisms to ensure safe navigation and to designate areas that differentiate the water uses and navigation areas on the waterways within the City of Newburyport.

recordTypes.name: How to Save and Resume a Draft of a Record
WPA Form 4A - Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation
recordTypes.description: The Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation (ANRAD) application provides a procedure for an applicant to confirm the delineation of a jurisdictional Wetland Resource Area or Areas.

recordTypes.name: Minor Modification
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request minor modifications of Planning Board decisions.  (A new permit application is required for material or significant changes.)

recordTypes.name: Alteration of Premises Outdoor Seating serving ALCOHOL  on PRIVATE PROPERTY
recordTypes.description: All alcohol Beverages

recordTypes.name: Resiliency Checklist - DRAFT
recordTypes.description: FOR TESTING ONLY

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition, and major repairs to existing buildings including commercial, and one and two family buildings.  Please note - Sheet Metal, Signs, Swimming Pools, and Wood Stoves have separate permits applications.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit (New Construction)
recordTypes.description: This application is used for to apply for building permits for construction of new buildings.

recordTypes.name: Alteration of Premises -Serving Alcohol
recordTypes.description: All alcohol Beverages

recordTypes.name: Minor Modification (ZBA)
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request minor modifications of Zoning Board of Appeals decisions.  (A new permit application is required for material or significant changes.)

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Subdivision
recordTypes.description: A Preliminary Subdivision Plan (PSP) may be submitted by an applicant to the Board for discussion and approval, modification, or disapproval by the Board. The submission of such a PSP enables the applicant, the Board, other municipal agencies, officials, and the public to discuss any problems the proposed subdivision may present before a Definitive Subdivision Plan is prepared.

recordTypes.name: WPA Form 7 - Extension Permit
recordTypes.description: The Extension Permit is used to extend the expiration date of an Order of Conditions.

recordTypes.name: Community Preservation Grant Application
recordTypes.description: This application is used to apply to the Community Preservation Committee for grant funding.

recordTypes.name: Repetitive Petition
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request review of repetitive petitions by the Planning Board and Zoning Board of Appeals pursuant to Section X-I Repetitive Petitions and Withdrawal.

recordTypes.name: WPA Form 8A - Certificate of Compliance
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request a Certificate of Compliance for an Order of Conditions from the Newburyport Conservation Commission.  If the project was issued a Superseding Order of Conditions or was the subject of an Adjudicatory Hearing Final Decision, submit your request to the appropriate DEP Regional Office (see https://www.mass.gov/service-details/massdep-regional-offices-by-community).

recordTypes.name: Special Permit for Non-Conformities
recordTypes.description: This application is to request a Special Permit for Non-Conformities from the Zoning Board of Appeals.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Application (DRAFT - DO NOT USE)
recordTypes.description:
This application is used to request the use of city streets and sidewalks for the purpose of road races, walkathons, bicycle, and other multidisciplined events.  

Applications must be submitted no later than 60 days in advance of requested event date.  The application will be internally reviewed and approved by appropriate Departments before being presented to the City Council for final approval.

recordTypes.name: Common Victualler License
recordTypes.description: If you are seeking an innholder with alcohol, please apply through the innholder link. Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Estalishment Permit to Operate Facility
Certificate of Inspection
recordTypes.description: Annual inspections for businesses & assembly buildings

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for complete demolition of a building and/or accessory building. For partial and interior demolition use the Building Permit application.

recordTypes.name: Common Victuallers  License renewals
recordTypes.description: Renewal Applicants Only: Apply for any or all of the above listed licenses.  If you are seeking an innholder with alcohol, please apply through the innholder link. Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Special Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request a Special Permit from the Zoning Board of Appeals.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Review
recordTypes.description: This application is to apply for site plan approval from the Planning Board.  Please see the site plan checklist (https://www.cityofnewburyport.com/planning-board/files/site-plan-review-checklist) for plan requirements.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Delay
recordTypes.description: This application is used to apply to the Historical Commission pursuant to the City's Demolition Delay Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Local Historic District Application
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request a Certificate of Appropriateness, a Certificate of Non-Applicability, or a Certificate of Hardship for projects located within the Fruit Street Historic District.

recordTypes.name: Special Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used to apply for Planning Board Special Permits.

recordTypes.name: Block Party
recordTypes.description:
Application must be submitted no later than 30 days in advance of requested block party date.
The application will be internally reviewed by the Office of the City Clerk, the Police Department, the Fire Department, and the Department of Public Services, before being presented to the City Council for final approval.

recordTypes.name: Variance
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request a variance from the zoning ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Entertainment License Application
recordTypes.description: All alcohol Beverages

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc.

recordTypes.name: Gas Fitter Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when natural gas/propane gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Lodging License
recordTypes.description: New Applicants Only: Apply for a Innholder/Lodging House License (includes dormitories, motels or hotels; excludes bed and breakfast and short term rentals, i.e. Airbnb), with or without alcohol.  Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Enforcement Request
recordTypes.description: This form is used to request enforcement of the Wetlands Protection Act or the Newburyport Wetlands Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Special Permit for Non-Conformities
recordTypes.description: This application is to request a Special Permit for Non-Conformities from the Planning Board for properties within the Downtown Overlay District (DOD).

recordTypes.name: Historical Advisory Report
recordTypes.description: Please use the required Zoning Board Special Permit application (https://newburyportma.viewpointcloud.com/categories/1092/record-types/1006588) or the Planning Board Special Permit application (https://newburyportma.viewpointcloud.com/categories/1093/record-types/1006590) cited in your Zoning Determination to request a Historical Report from the Historical Commission.  Your application will be reviewed by the Historical Commission prior to your public hearing being scheduled.

recordTypes.name: Minor Modification
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request minor modifications of Conservation Commission decisions.  Amended permit applications are required for material or significant changes.

recordTypes.name: One Day All Alcohol/Wine & Malt License
recordTypes.description: Application for one day alcohol license

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Checklist
recordTypes.description: The following checklist and/or documentation are required prior to a Health Department site inspection for sign off of a demolition building permit

recordTypes.name: Disposal Works Installer Permit
recordTypes.description:
The undersigned hereby applies for a DISPOSAL WORKS INSTALLER’S PERMIT to construct, alter,
install or repair subsurface sewage disposal systems as required by the provisions of the State Environmental
Code, Title V, and the rules and regulations of the Newburyport Board of Health.

recordTypes.name: Roof Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for new roof

recordTypes.name: Short-Term Rental Enforcement Request
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request enforcement of a Short-Term Rental Unit.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Letter Permit
recordTypes.description: Letter permits are issued only for projects within the outer 75 feet of the 100 foot buffer zone to wetland resource areas that have no chance of adversely impacting those resource areas (i.e., stream, riverbanks, ocean, coastal dune such as Plum Island Barrier Beach, vegetated wetlands, floodplain, etc.) or the related functions of the buffer zone.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Unit Application
recordTypes.description: This application is used to apply to the Licensing Commission for a Short-Term Rental Unit (STRU).

recordTypes.name: Sheet Metal Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when a sheet metal worker is manufacturing, fabricating, assembling, handling, erecting, installing, dismantling, alteration and/or repairing duct work, commercial fans, kitchen hoods and vents, architectural sheet metal and metal roofing.

recordTypes.name: Event Organizer Application
recordTypes.description: EVENT ORGANIZER APPLICATION FOR TEMPORARY FOOD SERVICE PERMIT: This permit is appropriate for organizers who will have multiple vendors participating at specific event.  Each Vendor Application will be included within this record -

recordTypes.name: Fats, Oils, Grease, Septage and Offal Substances Permit to Collect and Transport
recordTypes.description:
APPLICATION FOR SEPTAGE HAULER PERMIT

PERMIT FEE: $200 APPLICATION FEE (Includes first vehicle)          $50 for each additional vehicle

In accordance with M.G.L. c.111, Section 31B and 310CMR 15.502 (Title V), the
undersigned hereby makes application the Board of Health for permission to remove and
transport septage and fats, oils & grease (FOG) as set forth below.

recordTypes.name: Solar  Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition, and major repairs to existing buildings including commercial, and one and two family buildings.  Please note - Sheet Metal, Signs, Swimming Pools, and Wood Stoves have separate permits applications.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Plan Review
recordTypes.description: New establishments: Operator must complete and summit to the Newburyport Health Department

recordTypes.name: Ice Skating Rink Certification
recordTypes.description: The purpose of regulation 105 CMR 675.000 "Requirements to Maintain Air Quality in Indoor Skating Rinks (State Sanitary Code, Chapter XI) is to ensure the public health and safety of patrons who use indoor skating rinks by limiting air concentrations of carbon monoxide and nitrogen dioxide produced by fossil fuel resurfacing equipment to acceptable levels.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for permit to install, enlarge, or alter a swimming pool.

recordTypes.name: Tent, Awning, & Canopy Permit
recordTypes.description: Tent

recordTypes.name: MOBILE FOOD KITCHEN APPLICATION FOR PLAN REVIEW (105 CMR 590.011
Weatherization Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for weatherization and insulation only including commercial and one- and two-family buildings.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Establishment/ Kitchen - Application for Permit to Operate
recordTypes.description:
Mobile Food Vehicle:
Shall mean a food establishment that is located upon a vehicle, or which is pulled by a 
vehicle, where food or beverage is cooked, prepared and served for individual portion 
service. Mobile Food Vehicle shall mean a Mobile Food Kitchen

recordTypes.name: Window and Door Replacement Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for replacement and/or installation of windows and exterior doors.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Camps for Children License to Operate
Zoning Enforcement Request
recordTypes.description: This form is used to request enforcement of the Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Review
recordTypes.description: This application is used to request zoning review.  The Zoning Administrator will review your project and issue a Zoning Determination that identifies which land use permits are needed to proceed.  This application is a prerequisite to filing ZBA or Planning Board applications.

recordTypes.name: Tanning Facility Permit
recordTypes.description:
APPLICATION FOR TANNING FACILITY PERMIT 105 CMR 123.000

This permit is issued pursuant to the Massachusetts State Sanitary Code, 105CMR 123.000 and the City of Newburyport Board of Health Rules and Regulations: Chapter 3, Section 3.12.001 and subject to the provisions of the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts relating thereto and the Rules and Regulations related thereto.

recordTypes.name: Wood/Pellet Stove Permit
recordTypes.description: A building permit is required for the installation of any solid fuel burning appliance.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Vendor Application - LINKED TO SPECIFIC  EVENT ORGANIZER * EVO #
Zoning Review
recordTypes.description: Please use the Zoning Review application > Zoning Administration: https://newburyportma.portal.opengov.com/categories/1096/record-types/1006491

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Vendor Application - FARMERS MARKET SEASON /EVENT ORGANIZER * EVO #
Temporary Food Vendor Application
recordTypes.description: VENDOR APPLICATION FOR TEMPORARY FOOD SERVICE PERMIT

recordTypes.name: Solid Waste & Recycling - Permit to Collect and Transport
recordTypes.description: Application to the Health Department for a permit to remove, transport, and dispose of solid waste, and/or recycling material in the City of Newburyport in accordance with Chapter 111, Section 31, of the Massachusetts General Laws as amended and subject to Chapter 5 Section 5.5.002 of the Newburyport Board of Health Rules & Regulations and Section 8-83(g) of the Newburyport City Ordinance

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit to Operate
recordTypes.description:
Application is hereby made for a permit to operate a public, semi-public, wading, or special purpose pool. This pool is to be operated
according to the minimum standards for swimming pools set forth in Chapter V of the Sanitary Code of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts
and the City Newburyport Board of Health Rules and Regulations

recordTypes.name: Well - Plan Review & Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for new wells and replacement well work. If you have more than one well you intend to work on, this form must be filled out for EACH one.

categories.name: Building Department
categories.content:
HOW TO SCHEDULE AN INSPECTION

New Construction Building, Building Alterations, Swimming Pools, Signs, Wood Stove, Tent, Roof, Weatherization, Door & Windows, Solar and Sheet Metal Inspections: 

Call the Building Department (978-465-4405)

categories.name: Community Preservation Committee
categories.content: For more information, please visit the Newburyport Community Preservation Committee webpage or contact the CPC Administrator, Katelyn Sullivan at kesullivan@newburyportma.gov or (978) 465-4400.

categories.name: Conservation Commission
categories.content:
For more information, please visit the Newburyport Conservation Commission's webpage or contact the Conservation Administrator at (978) 465-4400 or conservation@newburyportma.gov.

Requests for Amendments to Orders of Conditions and Exten

categories.name: Fruit Street Historic District Commission
categories.content: Please visit the Local Historic District Commission's webpage for more information.

categories.name: Health Department
categories.content: For more information, please visit the Newburyport Health Department webpage by clicking here, or call our office at (978) 465-4410.

categories.name: Historical Commission
categories.content:
For more information, please visit the Newburyport Historical Commission's webpage or call Planning Department staff at (978) 465-4400.

Requests for minor modifications of approved Demolition Plans can be emailed to planning@newburyportma.gov.

categories.name: Planning Board
categories.content: See the Rules and Regulations Governing the Subdivision of Land and the City's

categories.name: Zoning Administration
categories.content: For more information, please visit the Newburyport Zoning Administration webpage or contact the Zoning Administrator, Jennifer Blanchet, at jblanchet@newburyportma.gov or (978) 465-4400.

categories.name: Zoning Board of Appeals
categories.content:
IMPORTANT - Zoning Review is a prerequisite of all Special Permits, Special Permits for Non-Conformities, and Variances. Please complete the application prior to applying to the Planning Board, Zoning Board of Appeals, or Historical Commission.

If you have any questions, please call Katelyn Sullivan at (

categories.name: Test Portal
categories.content: DO NOT USE.  The applications listed below are used for staff testing purposes only.
